intro: Neoporteria nidus var. multicolor, commonly known as the multicolored rock cress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, showy flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. The plant thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of basal leaves that are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white hairs. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging garden conditions.
